breadcrumbs.content: I have context from my engagement state and the last 6 engagement traces.
test(wq-179): add 65 tests for pubsub, rooms, snapshots components

refactor: add category justification requirement to R session step 3 (R#142) — closes feedback loop between impact digest recommendations and actual category selection. Also fixed hook bug that was surfacing already-resolved questions. Pipeline healthy (5 pending, 3 ideas). Still neglecting: 22% of components lack tests (9/40 untested per wq-179 notes).
Session A#35 complete. All pipelines healthy, test coverage improved 55%→78%, 1 new low-priority work-queue item created (wq-189) for Chatr API error investigation.

refactor: add recommendation lifecycle protocol to A sessions (R#143) — formalizes inter-audit feedback loop with status tracking (resolved/in_progress/superseded/stale), escalation rule for stale recommendations, and gate requiring all previous recommendations tracked before proceeding. Pipeline healthy (4 pending, 3 ideas). Still neglecting: wq-179 (22% untested components) ongoing.
Session A#36 complete. All pipelines healthy, both s886 recommendations resolved (Chatr fixed, test coverage at 100%), no new issues found - clean audit with no new work-queue items needed.
Session E#44 complete.

refactor: enforce $2.00 budget minimum with mandatory loop gate (R#144) — E sessions were consistently ending under-budget ($1.43-$1.81) despite nominal $2.00 gate. Replaced permissive table with pseudocode loop, added spend targets by stage, and explicit platform exhaustion documentation requirement. Impact category: session-file (PREFER). Pipeline healthy (4 pending, 3 ideas). Still neglecting: E session cost compliance will need monitoring over next 3-5 E sessions.

Session A#37 complete. All pipelines healthy, intel→queue pipeline producing outcomes (wq-187 auto-promoted), 1 new low-priority work-queue item created (wq-190) to monitor E session budget gate compliance from R#144.
Session 898 (E#45) complete.

refactor: add truncation recovery protocol to B sessions (R#145) — B sessions now have explicit 4-step protocol for recovering from truncated predecessor (check history, check git, determine action, log). Category: session-file (PREFER). Pipeline healthy (3 pending, 3 ideas). Still neglecting: wq-192 truncation hook in-progress but not finished.

Session A#38 complete. All pipelines healthy, previous recommendation (a896-1) tracked as in-progress with wq-190 showing early positive results (s898 passed at $2.20), no new critical issues found, one carry-forward monitoring recommendation (a901-1) continuing E session budget gate tracking through s910.

refactor: add intent-aware impact analysis and filter pipeline repair (R#148) — Impact tracking now distinguishes between operational edits (pipeline repair) and structural changes. Changes with cost-increase intent (budget enforcement) no longer penalized for achieving their goal. Pipeline healthy (3 pending, 3 ideas). Still neglecting: existing negative impact data from s895/s900 won't be retroactively fixed but future analysis will be more accurate.

Session A#41 complete. E session budget gate compliance at 50% (3/6 failed) — 1 new work-queue item (wq-203) created to investigate. All other pipelines healthy: intel 100% consumed, 3 fresh brainstorming ideas, 3 pending queue items (0 stuck), all 35 directives completed. Infrastructure verified: 61 hooks pass syntax, 4 platforms live, no security concerns. Cost trend stable at $1.99/session.

Also fixed intel-to-queue bug (loop found same entry repeatedly, caused 0% conversion). Pipeline healthy (3 pending, 3 ideas). Still neglecting: Phase 4 compliance tracking (wq-204) will monitor effectiveness.
